segment.source: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client
segment.target: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client

segment.source: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client
segment.target: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client

segment.source: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client
segment.target: Deploying the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 Sequencer and client enable administrators to virtualize and run virtualized applications.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 Sequencer and client enable administrators to virtualize and run virtualized applications.

segment.source: Deploy the client
segment.target: Deploy the client

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client is the component that runs a virtualized application on a target computer.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client is the component that runs a virtualized application on a target computer.

segment.source: The client enables users to interact with icons and to double-click file types, so that they can start a virtualized application.
segment.target: The client enables users to interact with icons and to double-click file types, so that they can start a virtualized application.

segment.source: The client can also obtain the virtual application content from the management server.
segment.target: The client can also obtain the virtual application content from the management server.

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V Client

segment.source: How to Uninstall the App-V 5.0 Client
segment.target: How to Uninstall the App-V 5.0 Client

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 4.6 and the App-V 5.0 Client on the Same Computer
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 4.6 and the App-V 5.0 Client on the Same Computer

segment.source: Client Configuration Settings
segment.target: Client Configuration Settings

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client stores its configuration in the registry.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client stores its configuration in the registry.

segment.source: You can gather some useful information about the client if you understand the format of data in the registry.
segment.target: You can gather some useful information about the client if you understand the format of data in the registry.

segment.source: You can also configure many client actions by changing registry entries.
segment.target: You can also configure many client actions by changing registry entries.

segment.source: About Client Configuration Settings
segment.target: About Client Configuration Settings

segment.source: Configure the client by using the ADMX template and Group Policy
segment.target: Configure the client by using the ADMX template and Group Policy

segment.source: You can use the Microsoft ADMX template to configure the client settings for the App-V 5.0 client and the Remote Desktop Services client.
segment.target: You can use the Microsoft ADMX template to configure the client settings for the App-V 5.0 client and the Remote Desktop Services client.

segment.source: The ADMX template manages common client configurations by using an existing Group Policy infrastructure and it includes settings for the App-V 5.0 client configuration.
segment.target: The ADMX template manages common client configurations by using an existing Group Policy infrastructure and it includes settings for the App-V 5.0 client configuration.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You can obtain the App-V 5.0 ADMX template from the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: You can obtain the App-V 5.0 ADMX template from the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: After you download and install the ADMX template, perform the following steps on the computer that you will use to manage Group Policy.
segment.target: After you download and install the ADMX template, perform the following steps on the computer that you will use to manage Group Policy.

segment.source: This is typically the Domain Controller.
segment.target: This is typically the Domain Controller.

segment.source: Save the .admx file to the following directory: Windows PolicyDefinitions
segment.target: Save the .admx file to the following directory: Windows PolicyDefinitions

segment.source: Save the .adml file to the following directory: Windows PolicyDefinitions Language Directory
segment.target: Save the .adml file to the following directory: Windows PolicyDefinitions Language Directory

segment.source: After you have completed the preceding steps, you can manage the App-V 5.0 client configuration settings with the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: After you have completed the preceding steps, you can manage the App-V 5.0 client configuration settings with the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client also stores its configuration in the registry.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client also stores its configuration in the registry.

segment.source: You can gather some useful information about the client if you understand the format of the data in the registry.
segment.target: You can gather some useful information about the client if you understand the format of the data in the registry.

segment.source: You can also configure many client actions by changing registry entries.
segment.target: You can also configure many client actions by changing registry entries.

segment.source: How to Modify App-V 5.0 Client Configuration Using the ADMX Template and Group Policy
segment.target: How to Modify App-V 5.0 Client Configuration Using the ADMX Template and Group Policy

segment.source: Deploy the client by using the Shared Content Store mode
segment.target: Deploy the client by using the Shared Content Store mode

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 Shared Content Store (SCS) mode enables the SCS App-V 5.0 clients to run virtualized applications without saving any of the associated package data locally.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 Shared Content Store (SCS) mode enables the SCS App-V 5.0 clients to run virtualized applications without saving any of the associated package data locally.

segment.source: All required virtualized package data is transmitted across the network; therefore, you should only use the SCS mode in environments with a fast connection.
segment.target: All required virtualized package data is transmitted across the network; therefore, you should only use the SCS mode in environments with a fast connection.

segment.source: Both the Remote Desktop Services (RDS) and the standard version of the App-V 5.0 client are supported with SCS mode.
segment.target: Both the Remote Desktop Services (RDS) and the standard version of the App-V 5.0 client are supported with SCS mode.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If the App-V 5.0 client is configured to run in the SCS mode, the location where the App-V 5.0 packages are streamed from must be available, otherwise, the virtualized package will fail.
segment.target: If the App-V 5.0 client is configured to run in the SCS mode, the location where the App-V 5.0 packages are streamed from must be available, otherwise, the virtualized package will fail.

segment.source: Additionally, we do not recommend deployment of virtualized applications to computers that run the App-V 5.0 client in the SCS mode across the internet.
segment.target: Additionally, we do not recommend deployment of virtualized applications to computers that run the App-V 5.0 client in the SCS mode across the internet.

segment.source: Additionally, the SCS is not a physical location that contains virtualized packages.
segment.target: Additionally, the SCS is not a physical location that contains virtualized packages.

segment.source: It is a mode that allows the App-V 5.0 client to stream the required virtualized package data across the network.
segment.target: It is a mode that allows the App-V 5.0 client to stream the required virtualized package data across the network.

segment.source: The SCS mode is helpful in the following scenarios:
segment.target: The SCS mode is helpful in the following scenarios:

segment.source: Virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) deployments
segment.target: Virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) deployments

segment.source: Remote desktop services (RDS) deployments
segment.target: Remote desktop services (RDS) deployments

segment.source: To use SCS in your environment, you must enable the App-V 5.0 client to run in SCS mode.
segment.target: To use SCS in your environment, you must enable the App-V 5.0 client to run in SCS mode.

segment.source: This setting should be specified during installation.
segment.target: This setting should be specified during installation.

segment.source: By default, the client is not configured to use SCS mode.
segment.target: By default, the client is not configured to use SCS mode.

segment.source: You should install the client by using the suggested procedure if you plan to use SCS.
segment.target: You should install the client by using the suggested procedure if you plan to use SCS.

segment.source: However, you can configure an existing App-V 5.0 client to run in SCS mode by entering the following PowerShell command on the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client:
segment.target: However, you can configure an existing App-V 5.0 client to run in SCS mode by entering the following PowerShell command on the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client:

segment.source: set-AppvClientConfiguration -SharedContentStoreMode 1
segment.target: set-AppvClientConfiguration -SharedContentStoreMode 1

segment.source: There might be cases when the administrator pre-loads some virtual applications on the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client in SCS mode.
segment.target: There might be cases when the administrator pre-loads some virtual applications on the computer that runs the App-V 5.0 client in SCS mode.

segment.source: This can be accomplished with PowerShell commands to add, publish, and mount the package.
segment.target: This can be accomplished with PowerShell commands to add, publish, and mount the package.

segment.source: For example, if a package is pre-loaded on all computers, the administrator could add, publish, and mount the package by using PowerShell commands.
segment.target: For example, if a package is pre-loaded on all computers, the administrator could add, publish, and mount the package by using PowerShell commands.

segment.source: The package would not stream across the network because it would be locally stored.
segment.target: The package would not stream across the network because it would be locally stored.

segment.source: How to Install the App-V 5.0 Client for Shared Content Store Mode
segment.target: How to Install the App-V 5.0 Client for Shared Content Store Mode

segment.source: Deploy the Sequencer
segment.target: Deploy the Sequencer

segment.source: The Sequencer is a tool that is used to convert standard applications into virtual packages for deployment to computers that run the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: The Sequencer is a tool that is used to convert standard applications into virtual packages for deployment to computers that run the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: The Sequencer helps provide a simple and predictable conversion process with minimal changes to prior sequencing workflows.
segment.target: The Sequencer helps provide a simple and predictable conversion process with minimal changes to prior sequencing workflows.

segment.source: In addition, the Sequencer allows users to more easily configure applications to enable connections of virtualized applications.
segment.target: In addition, the Sequencer allows users to more easily configure applications to enable connections of virtualized applications.

segment.source: For a list of changes in the App-V 5.0 Sequencer, see What's New in App-V 5.0.
segment.target: For a list of changes in the App-V 5.0 Sequencer, see What's New in App-V 5.0.

segment.source: How to Install the Sequencer
segment.target: How to Install the Sequencer

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Client and Sequencer logs
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Client and Sequencer logs

segment.source: You can use the App-V 5.0 Sequencer log information to help troubleshoot the Sequencer installation and operational events while using App-V 5.0.
segment.target: You can use the App-V 5.0 Sequencer log information to help troubleshoot the Sequencer installation and operational events while using App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The Sequencer-related log information can be reviewed with the Event Viewer.
segment.target: The Sequencer-related log information can be reviewed with the Event Viewer.

segment.source: The following line displays the specific path for Sequencer-related events:
segment.target: The following line displays the specific path for Sequencer-related events:

segment.source: Event Viewer Applications and Services Logs Microsoft App V. Sequencer-related events are prepended with AppVSequencer.
segment.target: Event Viewer Applications and Services Logs Microsoft App V. Sequencer-related events are prepended with AppVSequencer.

segment.source: Client-related events are prepended with AppVClient.
segment.target: Client-related events are prepended with AppVClient.

segment.source: In App-V 5.0 SP3, some logs have been consolidated.
segment.target: In App-V 5.0 SP3, some logs have been consolidated.

segment.source: See About App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: See About App-V 5.0 SP3.
